To determine the maximum number of units that can be transported daily, we need to consider the production rates of each factory and the demand of every warehouse.

Total production capacity of all factories:
Factory 1: 50 units/day
Factory 2: 60 units/day
Factory 3: 40 units/day
Factory 4: 70 units/day
Total production capacity: 50 + 60 + 40 + 70 = 220 units/day

Total demand of all warehouses:
Warehouse A: 80 units/day
Warehouse B: 50 units/day
Warehouse C: 90 units/day
Total demand: 80 + 50 + 90 = 220 units/day

Since the total production capacity of all factories is equal to the total demand of all warehouses, it is possible to transport the maximum number of units daily, satisfying the production rates of each factory and the demand of every warehouse.

The maximum number of units that can be transported daily is 220 units.
